title: Race Against Time: Fixing a Critical Issue Before Launch
hook: At 2am, two weeks before our biggest launch, I discovered a race condition that would have double-charged every customer on every order.

situation.summary: Two weeks before a major launch, I was paged at 2am with a critical issue in our newly migrated microservices architecture. A race condition in the data sync layer threatened to double-charge customers on every orderâ€”an outcome that could have caused widespread financial and reputational damage.
evidence: Critical production issue in data sync layer
Potential impact: customer double-charges on every order

obstacles.summary: The issue was buried deep within the interactions of three newly created services, making it challenging to trace and debug. Additionally, the urgency of the situation required immediate action to prevent disruption to the launch timeline.
evidence: Urgency: 72 hours to resolve before launch

actions.summary: I pulled in Sarah from platform, Marcus from the orders team, and Dev, a contractor familiar with the legacy system. Over 72 hours, we worked around the clock to trace the issue across three services, testing theories and validating fixes before deploying the solution at 4:17am.
evidence: Team members involved: Sarah, Marcus, Dev

results.summary: The fix prevented customer double-charges, ensuring zero incidents during the launch. Post-migration, deployment frequency improved from bi-weekly to 5-10 times daily, and the runbook I created for handling similar issues remains in use 18 months later.
evidence: Deployment frequency increased from bi-weekly to daily (5-10x)
Runbook still in use after 18 months

reasoning: The story was structured to emphasize the urgency of the crisis, the complexity of the obstacle, the decisive and collaborative response, and the tangible results both during and after the event. By including specific details about the timeline, people involved, and quantified outcomes, the narrative creates a compelling and credible account of handling a high-stakes situation.
